plant_translocations.content: The study investigated the impact of two fatty amine surfactants, Armoblen 557 and Ethomeen T/27, on the foliar absorption, translocation, and efficacy of 2,4-dichlorophenoxyacetic acid triethanolamine salt (2,4-DTR). The results showed that both surfactants significantly enhanced the foliar absorption of 2,4-DTR in black nightshade (Solanum nigrum L.) when applied at a concentration of 0.5% (w/v), increasing absorption by a factor of 4. However, applying the surfactants at a concentration of 0.05% (w/v) had no effect on absorption. The surfactants also reduced the translocation efficiency of 14C from 2,4-DTR in black nightshade by a factor of 1.5-2. Additionally, both surfactants greatly improved the efficacy of 2,4-DTR when applied at a concentration of 2.4 mM in the spray solution. At a higher concentration of 11.3 mM, the surfactants enhanced efficacy at a concentration of 0.5% but not at 0.05%. The findings suggested that altering the hydrophilic/lipophilic characteristics of the fatty amine surfactant by incorporating propylene oxide groups did not influence the absorption and efficacy of 2,4-DTR.
plant_translocations.reference: de Ruiter, H., Straatman, K. R., & Meinen, E. (1995). Influence of two fatty amine surfactants on foliar absorption, translocation, and efficacy of 2, 4-D triethanolamine salt. Journal of Agricultural and Food Chemistry, 43(12), 3093-3097.

method.Plant Grown Condition: Hydroponically in a growth chamber under 14 hours of light, 18/12(±0.5) °C (day/night) temperature, and 70/80 (±5)% (day/night) relative humidity. The experiments with 14C-labeled herbicides were performed in an identical growth chamber under the same conditions, except that the night temperature was 18°C.
method.Chemical Preparation: 2,4-D triethanolamine salt (2,4-DTR) and 2,4-Dichlorophenoxy[2-14C]acetic acid triethanolamine salt were used. The concentrations of 2,4-DTR (labeled plus unlabeled) were 11.3 mM (specific activity 29.47 MBq mmol-1), equivalent to the molarity of 2,4-D acid when applied at a rate of 1 kg ha-1 at a spray volume of 400 L ha-1. The specific activity of the radioactive 2,4-DTR was 12.8 x 1010 and 44.8 x 1010 Bq/tmol-1, respectively. Additional solutions were prepared in which 2,4-DTR and 2,4-D were combined, and the 14C-label was associated with either 2,4-DTR or 2,4-D.
method.Pesticide Application Details for the Pl: The solutions were applied to the leaf surface as five 1-µL drops (334 Bq, µL-1) to a discrete area (diameter < 1 cm) on the adaxial surface in the median part of the leaf, outlined with waterproof ink. It took 1 h to apply all of the herbicide solutions.
method.Other Information: The experiments were part of a program using several species. Acetone was added to the 2,4-DTR solutions to facilitate the application of drops to difficult-to-wet leaf surfaces. The efficiency of the washing procedure was extensively tested, and recovery of 100% was measured.

plant_translocations.result: [{"Surfactants": "-", "Uptake (% of applied)": 8.0, "Translocation": 3.2, "Translocation/Uptake x 100%": 44.0, "Recovery (%)": 100.3}, {"Surfactants": "0.05% A557", "Uptake (% of applied)": 8.0, "Translocation": 2.7, "Translocation/Uptake x 100%": 41.5, "Recovery (%)": 94.4}, {"Surfactants": "0.5% A557", "Uptake (% of applied)": 32.4, "Translocation": 7.9, "Translocation/Uptake x 100%": 27.8, "Recovery (%)": 84.5}, {"Surfactants": "0.05% ET/27", "Uptake (% of applied)": 5.4, "Translocation": 2.6, "Translocation/Uptake x 100%": 54.1, "Recovery (%)": 100.2}, {"Surfactants": "0.5% ET/27", "Uptake (% of applied)": 30.7, "Translocation": 5.9, "Translocation/Uptake x 100%": 25.2, "Recovery (%)": 91.9}]
